title: Aatrox's dive should be uniinterruptible with full bloodwell
body:
We all know his dive is unreliable with a pretty long cool down.  I think making it always uninterruptible would be a little much.

However, it should be changed to be uninterruptible while Aatrox's bloodwell is full.

This is a small buff that rewards players for keeping his bloodwell full. 

Upvote and comment.

replies.body: I love the idea of giving aatrox some love, but think he needs kit changes that keep his thematic, not compensation buffs to a pretty dull kit

His theme clearly puts him as some inspiring leader, a master or war who can give the edge to fighters who are in a fight that they feel they are behind....nothing in his kit reflects that, so I have no idea what you are talking about.
To be fair, Swain's supposed to be a Master Tactician, but until the Rework his niche is 'Demon Bird Drain Tank'

Some Swain players like to think that Swain's show of his prowess in magic and battle is a statement to the world that he NOT just some weak brittle character with a genius mind.
Therefore, he COULD use his tactics but he's so powerful he doesn't need to!

As a roleplayer I think that's a mistake. He **WANTS** people to underestimate him because they make exploitable mistakes. A true Tactician need only rely on their mind (though Magic certainly helps)

I don't mind the Ult, but I think if they tried they could make a more interesting kit.

Swain on the summoners rift is an example of swain who's basically backed into a corner. He doesn't have an army to command. No escape routes, least none that will confirm his survival. In the moment of truth, he reveals his true power, as people normally would believe him to be weaker since he has to be a tactician.

I'm not saying if the kit fits it or not, but that's a way to look at swain in game. Cornered and out of options.

A counter example is Sivir's ultimate.

In Aatrox's lore the Protectorates were severely outnumbered and I believed had been augmented by Aatrox's presence, somehow, though powerfully. 

>  Soon, the warriors found themselves imbued with a potent thirst for battle. They followed Aatrox into the fray, each fighting with the furious strength of ten... 

I don't think it's too far-fetched to place an area of effect ally buff ability or effect on Aatrox. Conversely Sivir's lore doesn't have any scenarios as powerful as the one I just quoted and she has an area of effect ally buff ultimate. 
____
Given all this, I don't think the Riot champion creation or Riot's champion rework team follows the translation from lore to gameplay as strict as I think they should. Sion doesn't need to have CC immunity charge ability as much as Aatrox would have an area ally buff. 

There's also the gameplay philosophy with Garen that Riot tries to keep him as one of the LESS complex characters in the game since he is meant to be a starter character. For players who are new and are more focused on their own performance - therefore an area ally buff effect wouldn't be such a priority on Garen.
____
It's been 3 years since Riot has reworked or have taken an extensively rethink of the idea of Sivir, so their gameplay philosophy since then may have changed.
